about.title: Nyon Livestream Server
about.subtitle: Low-Latency Streaming Platform
about.betaNotice: This is a beta version. The project is under active development. Version 1.0.0 will be released once all core features are stable and thoroughly tested.
about.author: Author
about.nonProfitDesc: Free and open-source software for the community
about.description: Nyon Livestream Server is a lightweight, low-latency streaming platform designed specifically for Raspberry Pi and similar ARM-based devices. It enables you to ingest video streams from cameras, drones, or mobile devices and distribute them with minimal delay.
about.lowLatencyDesc: Sub-second streaming delay using HTTP-FLV and optimized SRS configuration
about.multipleProtocolsDesc: RTMP and SRT for publishing, HTTP-FLV for playback
about.resourceEfficientDesc: Relay-only mode uses minimal CPU and memory
about.webManagementDesc: Modern React-based dashboard for stream management
about.dualNetworkDesc: LAN and Public IP access with automatic detection
about.sessionMonitoringDesc: Real-time viewer tracking and bandwidth monitoring
about.roadmapItem1: Complete stability testing on Raspberry Pi 3/4/5
about.contactDesc: This is a community-driven project. If you encounter issues, have feature requests, or want to contribute, please reach out:
about.tagline: Built with passion for the maker community. Enjoy streaming!

help.pageSubtitle: Learn how to use Nyon Livestream Server for low-latency streaming

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.step1: Create a stream in the Streams tab
quickStart.step2: Copy the RTMP or SRT URL
quickStart.step4: Start streaming and watch it live in the dashboard

creating.title: Creating a New Stream
creating.step3b: Stream Key: Click "Generate" for a secure random key, enter a custom key, or leave blank to auto-generate
creating.step3d: Protocol: Choose RTMP, SRT, or RTMP + SRT
creating.step3e: Max Bitrate: Maximum allowed bitrate (recommended: 2500-5000 kbps for 1080p)

editing.title: Editing Streams
editing.item1: Click the pencil icon on any stream card
editing.item2: Modify any field including the stream key
editing.item3: Warning: Changing the stream key will invalidate existing URLs. Active streams will be disconnected.

deleting.title: Deleting Streams
deleting.item1: Click the trash icon on the stream card
deleting.item3: All active sessions will be terminated

regenerating.title: Regenerating Stream Keys
regenerating.item1: Click the key icon to generate a new random stream key
regenerating.item2: Useful if you suspect your stream key has been compromised
regenerating.item3: Update your streaming software with the new key

gettingUrls.title: Getting Stream URLs
gettingUrls.step1: Expand a stream by clicking on it
gettingUrls.step2: You'll see URLs for both LAN and Public access
gettingUrls.step3: Click the copy icon to copy any URL

obs.title: Using OBS Studio
obs.step4b: Stream Key: Your stream key from the dashboard

ffmpeg.title: Using FFmpeg (Advanced)
ffmpeg.rtmpCommand:
ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libx264 -preset ultrafast \
  -b:v 3000k -c:a aac -f flv \
  rtmp://YOUR_IP:1935/live/YOUR_KEY
ffmpeg.srtCommand:
ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libx264 -preset ultrafast \
  -b:v 3000k -c:a aac -f mpegts \
  "srt://YOUR_IP:10080?streamid=YOUR_KEY"

dashboard.title: In-Dashboard Playback
dashboard.step1: When a stream is live, you'll see a green "LIVE" badge
dashboard.step3: The stream will expand and auto-scroll to the video player
dashboard.step4: Use video controls to play/pause, adjust volume, or fullscreen

vlc.title: Using VLC Media Player
vlc.step3: Copy the HTTP-FLV playback URL from dashboard
vlc.step6: Tip: In VLC settings, reduce network caching to 50-100ms for lower latency

obsRestream.title: Using OBS for Restreaming
obsRestream.step3: Check "Restart playback when source becomes active"
obsRestream.step4: You can now restream to YouTube, Twitch, etc.

active.title: Active Sessions
active.description: The Sessions tab shows all active streaming connections in real-time.
active.streamName: Stream Name: Which stream is being published
active.clientId: Client ID: Unique identifier for the connection
active.ipAddress: IP Address: Source IP of the publisher
active.duration: Duration: How long the stream has been active

disconnecting.title: Disconnecting Sessions
disconnecting.item1: Click the red X icon next to any session
disconnecting.item2: The publisher will be disconnected immediately
disconnecting.item3: Useful for ending unwanted or unauthorized streams

password.title: Changing Password
password.step6: You'll be logged out and need to log in with the new password

network.title: Network Configuration
network.item1: The server automatically detects your LAN IP
network.item3: All stream URLs will show both LAN and Public variants
network.item4: Use LAN URLs for local network, Public URLs for internet access

security.title: Stream Key Security
security.item2: Use auto-generated keys for better security
security.item3: Regenerate keys if you suspect they've been compromised
security.item4: Disable streams when not in use

connection.title: Stream Won't Connect
connection.item1: Verify the stream URL and key are correct
connection.item2: Check that the stream is Active (not disabled)
connection.item3: Ensure firewall allows connections on ports 1935 (RTMP) and 10080 (SRT)
connection.item4: Try using LAN IP instead of Public IP if on same network

latency.title: High Latency / Buffering
latency.item1: Reduce bitrate in your encoder (OBS, FFmpeg)
latency.item2: Use wired ethernet instead of WiFi if possible
latency.item4: SRT typically has lower latency than RTMP

blackScreen.title: Video Player Shows Black Screen
blackScreen.item1: Hard refresh the page (Ctrl+Shift+R or Cmd+Shift+R)
blackScreen.item2: Verify the stream is actually publishing (check Sessions tab)
blackScreen.item3: Try opening the HTTP-FLV URL directly in VLC to test
blackScreen.item4: Check browser console for errors (F12 ‚Üí Console)

copyButtons.title: Copy Buttons Not Working
copyButtons.item1: Modern browsers may restrict clipboard access on HTTP (not HTTPS)
copyButtons.item2: The app has a fallback method that should work
copyButtons.item3: If alerts show the URL, you can manually copy it
copyButtons.item4: Alternatively, manually type/copy the URL from the display
